title: Sync Configuration
description: Configuration for organization-wide label, file, and smyklot version synchronization. Place at .github/sync-config.yml in your repository.

BranchProtectionRuleConfig.description: Configures protection rules for branches including required status checks, required reviews, and restrictions on who can push

allow_force_pushes.description: Allow force pushes to this branch

enforce_admins.description: Enforce branch protection rules for administrators

required_conversation_resolution.description: Require all conversations on code to be resolved before pull request can be merged

restrictions.description: Restrict who can push to this branch. Leave unset to allow all users with push access

BranchRestrictionsConfig.description: BranchRestrictionsConfig defines who can push to protected branches.

apps.description: GitHub App slugs allowed to push

teams.description: GitHub team slugs allowed to push

BypassActorConfig.description: Defines an actor (user, team, app, or role) who can bypass ruleset requirements

actor_id.description: Actor ID (user ID, team ID, app ID, or role ID)

actor_type.description: Actor type (Integration, OrganizationAdmin, RepositoryRole, or Team)

BypassPullRequestAllowances.description: BypassPullRequestAllowances defines who can bypass pull request requirements.

apps.description: GitHub App slugs that can bypass pull request requirements

teams.description: GitHub team slugs that can bypass pull request requirements

users.description: GitHub usernames that can bypass pull request requirements

CodeScanningRuleConfig.description: Configures code scanning tool requirements and alert thresholds

code_scanning_tools.description: Code scanning tools and their thresholds

CodeScanningToolConfig.description: Defines a code scanning tool with alert thresholds

alerts_threshold.description: Alert threshold level (none, errors, errors_and_warnings, all)

security_alerts_threshold.description: Security alert threshold level (none, critical, high_or_higher, medium_or_higher, all)

FeaturesConfig.description: Controls which GitHub features are enabled for the repository (Issues, Wiki, Projects, Discussions)

FileMergeConfig.description: Configures merge behavior for specific files, allowing repo-specific customization of fields while inheriting org defaults

arrayStrategies.description: Per-path array merge strategies. Maps JSONPath expressions (exact match only, e.g., "$.packageRules") to merge strategy (append/prepend/replace). Only applies to arrays in the merged result. If not specified, arrays are replaced (RFC 7396 default behavior)

deduplicateArrays.description: Removes duplicate elements from arrays after applying array merge strategies. Uses deep equality comparison for objects. Has no effect if arrayStrategies is not configured

overrides.description: Static override values to merge with the org template. These values take precedence over org defaults. Use null to explicitly remove a field from the result

path.description: File path (relative to repo root) to merge. Must be a JSON or YAML file

strategy.description: Merge strategy to use. deep-merge (default) recursively merges nested objects; shallow-merge only merges top-level keys

FilesConfig.description: Controls which organization template files (CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, CONTRIBUTING.md, etc.) are synced to this repository, with options to exclude specific files or remove unmanaged files

allow_removal.description: DANGEROUS: When true, files in this repo that are NOT in the central sync config will be DELETED. This can cause data loss. Strongly recommend keeping this false

exclude.description: File paths (relative to repo root) to exclude from sync. These files will NOT be created/updated in this repository. Existing files at these paths are preserved but not managed

merge.description: Files to merge with repo-specific overrides instead of replacing. Allows customizing specific fields while inheriting org defaults

skip.description: Skip file synchronization only. Label sync still runs unless sync.skip or sync.labels.skip is true

LabelsConfig.description: Manages which GitHub labels are synced from central configuration, with options to exclude specific labels or remove labels not in the central config

allow_removal.description: When true, labels in this repo that are NOT in the central config will be DELETED. Use with caution - this removes custom labels

exclude.description: Label names to exclude from synchronization. These labels will NOT be created/updated in this repository. Existing labels with these names are preserved but not managed

skip.description: Skip label synchronization only. File sync still runs unless sync.skip or sync.files.skip is true

PullRequestRuleConfig.description: Configures pull request requirements including reviews, code owners, and merge strategies

dismiss_stale_reviews_on_push.description: Dismiss stale reviews when new commits are pushed

require_last_push_approval.description: Require approval of the most recent reviewable push

required_review_thread_resolution.description: Require all conversations to be resolved before merging

RefNameCondition.description: Specifies include/exclude patterns for ref names (branches or tags)

RepositorySettingsConfig.description: Configures merge strategies and branch cleanup behavior for pull requests

allow_merge_commit.description: Allow merge commits for pull requests

allow_rebase_merge.description: Allow rebase merge for pull requests

allow_squash_merge.description: Allow squash merge for pull requests

allow_update_branch.description: Allow users to update the head branch of a pull request with the latest changes from the base branch

delete_branch_on_merge.description: Automatically delete head branch after pull request is merged

squash_merge_commit_message.description: Message format for squash merge commits (PR_BODY, COMMIT_MESSAGES, or BLANK)

squash_merge_commit_title.description: Title format for squash merge commits (COMMIT_OR_PR_TITLE or PR_TITLE)

RequiredReviews.description: Configures pull request review requirements including approval count, code owner reviews, and who can bypass requirements

bypass_pull_request_allowances.description: Allow specified users, teams, or apps to bypass pull request requirements

dismiss_stale.description: Dismiss stale pull request approvals when new commits are pushed

require_last_push_approval.description: Require approval of the most recent reviewable push

RequiredStatusChecks.description: Specifies CI/CD checks that must pass before merging, with option to require branches be up-to-date

contexts.description: Required status check contexts. Empty array inherits repo's existing checks (hybrid approach)

strict.description: Require branches to be up to date before merging

RulesetConditionsConfig.description: Defines conditions for when a ruleset applies, primarily using ref name patterns

RulesetConfig.description: Configures GitHub Rulesets (modern replacement for branch protection) with more granular targeting, additional rule types, better bypass management, and enforcement modes

bypass_actors.description: Actors who can bypass this ruleset

RulesetRulesConfig.description: Contains all rule types that can be enforced by a ruleset

pull_request.description: Pull request rules (reviews, dismissal, code owners)

required_linear_history.description: Require linear commit history (no merge commits)

required_status_checks.description: Required status checks that must pass

SecurityConfig.description: Configures GitHub Advanced Security features including secret scanning and Dependabot security updates

secret_scanning.description: Enable secret scanning (requires GitHub Advanced Security)

secret_scanning_push_protection.description: Enable secret scanning push protection (requires GitHub Advanced Security and secret scanning enabled)

SettingsConfig.description: Controls synchronization of GitHub repository settings like merge strategies, branch protection, security features, and access controls

exclude.description: Specific settings sections or fields to exclude from sync

merge.description: Settings sections to merge with repo-specific overrides instead of replacing. Allows customizing specific fields while inheriting org defaults

skip.description: Skip repository settings synchronization. Other sync operations still run unless their respective skip flags are set

SettingsMergeConfig.description: Configures merge behavior for specific settings sections, allowing repo-specific customization of fields while inheriting org defaults.

overrides.description: Override values to merge with org settings. Structure should match the section type (repository, features, security, branch protection rule, or ruleset). Only specified fields will override org defaults.

anyOf.description: Custom override object for advanced use cases

section.description: Section identifier to merge. Use "repository", "features", or "security" for top-level sections. For branch protection rules, use the pattern (e.g., "main", "release/*"). For rulesets, use the ruleset name

strategy.description: Merge strategy to use. deep-merge (default) recursively merges nested objects; shallow-merge only merges top-level keys

SettingsOverride_BranchProtectionRuleCon.description: Partial BranchProtectionRuleConfig for merge overrides. Only specified fields will override org defaults.

allow_force_pushes.description: Allow force pushes to this branch

enforce_admins.description: Enforce branch protection rules for administrators

required_conversation_resolution.description: Require all conversations on code to be resolved before pull request can be merged

restrictions.description: Restrict who can push to this branch. Leave unset to allow all users with push access

SettingsOverride_FeaturesConfig.description: Partial FeaturesConfig for merge overrides. Only specified fields will override org defaults.

SettingsOverride_RepositorySettingsConfi.description: Partial RepositorySettingsConfig for merge overrides. Only specified fields will override org defaults.

allow_merge_commit.description: Allow merge commits for pull requests

allow_rebase_merge.description: Allow rebase merge for pull requests

allow_squash_merge.description: Allow squash merge for pull requests

allow_update_branch.description: Allow users to update the head branch of a pull request with the latest changes from the base branch

delete_branch_on_merge.description: Automatically delete head branch after pull request is merged

squash_merge_commit_message.description: Message format for squash merge commits (PR_BODY, COMMIT_MESSAGES, or BLANK)

squash_merge_commit_title.description: Title format for squash merge commits (COMMIT_OR_PR_TITLE or PR_TITLE)

SettingsOverride_RulesetConfig.description: Partial RulesetConfig for merge overrides. Only specified fields will override org defaults.

bypass_actors.description: Actors who can bypass this ruleset

SettingsOverride_SecurityConfig.description: Partial SecurityConfig for merge overrides. Only specified fields will override org defaults.

secret_scanning.description: Enable secret scanning (requires GitHub Advanced Security)

secret_scanning_push_protection.description: Enable secret scanning push protection (requires GitHub Advanced Security and secret scanning enabled)

SmyklotConfig.description: Controls automatic updates of smyklot version references in workflow files when new versions are released, and which workflows to install/sync

skip.description: Skip ALL smyklot synchronization (both workflows and version updates). Label and file sync still run unless their respective skip flags are set. Use this for repos that don't use smyklot at all

workflows.description: Which smyklot workflows to sync to this repository. Allows per-repo control over workflow installation

SmyklotVersionConfig.description: Controls version-only updates in non-managed workflow files

skip.description: Skip version-only updates in workflow files. Managed workflows (smyklot-pr-commands, smyklot-poll) are still synced unless their respective workflow flags are disabled

SmyklotWorkflowsConfig.description: Controls which smyklot workflows are synced to a repository

StatusCheckConfig.description: Defines a single required status check with context name and optional integration ID

integration_id.description: Integration ID for GitHub App status checks (optional)

StatusChecksRuleConfig.description: Specifies CI/CD status checks that must pass, with option to require strict updates

do_not_enforce_on_create.description: When true, do not enforce status check requirements on branches created from protected branches. New branches can temporarily bypass checks when first created

required_status_checks.description: Required status checks. Empty array = skip setting checks (inherit repo's existing)

strict_required_status_checks_policy.description: Require branches to be up to date before merging (strict mode)

SyncConfig.description: Configuration for controlling organization-wide synchronization of labels, files, smyklot versions, and repository settings across all repositories

sync.description: Top-level sync configuration controlling label, file, and smyklot version synchronization behavior

SyncSettings.description: Centralized control for all synchronization operations including labels, files, smyklot versions, and repository settings

skip.description: Skip ALL syncs for this repository. Equivalent to setting labels.skip, files.skip, smyklot.skip, and settings.skip to true
